We hope you enjoy your journey with us. If you have any questions or need assistance, feel free to reach out. Get Started Cheers,The ACME Team Reach humans, not spam folders Be the first to know if your domain is added to a DNSBLs such as those offered by Spamhaus with removal requests generated by Resend. DNSBLs Spamhaus Send emails from the region closest to your users. Reduce delivery latency with North American, South American, European, and Asian regions. Showcase your logo and company branding with BIMI. Receive guidance to obtain a VMC - the email equivalent of a checkmark on social media. BIMI VMC Get a fully managed dedicated IP that automatically warms up and autoscales based on your sending volume, no waiting period. Prevent repeated sending to recipients who no longer want your email and comply with standards like the CAN-SPAM Act and others. CAN-SPAM Act Monitor your DNS configuration for any errors or regressions. Be notified of any changes that could hinder your deliverability. Protect your reputation by verifying your identity as a legitimate sender. Secure your email communication using DKIM and SPF. DKIM SPF Rely on a platform of reputable IP's used by trustworthy senders with distributed workloads across different IP pools. Avoid impersonation by creating DMARC policies and instructing inbox providers on how to treat unauthenticated email. DMARC Resend is transforming email for developers. Simple interface, easy integrations, handy templates. What else could we ask for. Guillermo Rauch CEO at Vercel Send with Next.js Everything in your control All the features you need to manage your email sending, troubleshoot with detailed logs, and protect your domain reputation – without the friction. Intuitive Analytics Full Visibility Domain Authentication Beyond expectations Resend is driving remarkable developer experiences that enable successstories, empower businesses, and fuel growth across industries and individuals. Open main menu Features Company Resources Help Docs Pricing Resend + a16z Resend is designed from the ground up for startups. We've built a fully integrated platform to give teams the fastest way to send emails. Claim deal Used by startups of all sizes Used by startups of all sizes Read more Read more Read more Read more Read more Read more Read more Read more Read more Read more Read more Read more Our startup story On September 12th, 2022 we submitted our YC application. We didn't think we would get in, we didn't think we were special enough, but somehow they invited us for an interview. On November 30th, after pitching the idea to folks like Gustaf, Harj, and Diana, they finally accepted our application! We immediately quit our jobs and moved to San Francisco to start Resend. We joined the Winter 2023 batch, and had 3 months to get traction before Demo Day. It was crazy, we worked non-stop, made tons of mistakes, but most of all, made friends for life. YC was a special moment for us and we hope we can give back somehow. — Zeno Rocha, Founder & CEO The obligatory photo in front of the YC sign Companies using Resend Companies using Resend Start sending in minutes Resend delivers mission-critical emails for some of the fastest growing teams.

Open main menu Features Company Resources Help Docs Pricing Building the modern email sending platform The web has come a long way in the last ten years, but why is email stuck in the past?It doesn't have to be that way. We want to change that. We want to reimagine email. Building the modern email sending platform The web has come a long way in the last ten years, but why is email stuck in the past?It doesn't have to be that way. We want to change that. We want to reimagine email. Our story Our story Resend started with an open source project in 2022. We were frustrated by how difficult it was to build modern email templates that worked well across all email clients.As we started to dig deeper, it became clear that this was just the tip of the iceberg. We realized that sending emails that reach the inbox (not the spam folder) was the biggest pain point, so we started to explore something new.In 2023, we launched an entire email sending platform and joined Y Combinator's winter batch. We're creating something special here, and we're excited to build it with you. The team behind it A fully remote team on a mission to buildthe best communication platform for developers. Resend Team at Florence Offsite 2025 What we believe What we believe Principles that dictate how we think, behave, and make decisions. Zeno Rocha <zeno@resend.com> Do work that inspires others You can't inspire people by doing an “okay” job. To inspire, you need to do phenomenal work. Quality is not a plus; it's a must-have. We know nothing will ever be perfect, but that doesn't stop us from pushing the limits. We don't want to just meet the bar of our peers. We want to raise the bar. The sum of all the small details is what makes something special. Jonni Lundy <jonni@resend.com> No ego Helping others is part of the job. It's okay to admit you don't know something and ask for help - it's a sign of strength, not weakness. We work together as an async team and assume positive intent. We communicate in a kind, direct, and transparent way. Bu Kinoshita <bu@resend.com> Keep shipping Speed is key. We prioritize ruthlessly, have a strong sense of urgency, and make decisions fast. We constantly review the scope of a project and work toward a v0, not a v1. We ship early, and we ship often. Zeh Fernandes <zeh@resend.com> Default to action Regardless of what you do, we are all makers, and makers don't wait. When we see a problem, we don't expect someone to fix it or tell us what to do. Instead, we take initiative, find creative ways around it, and send a pull request to solve it. Remember - no problem is too small. Backed by incredible investors We are fortunate to work with some of the best investors in the world. Chances are you are already using the products they helped to create. Ali Rowghani Investor, ex-CFO of Pixar Alana Goyal Founder of Basecase Ahmad Awais Founder of Langbase Beth Turner Partner at SV Angel Britton Winterrose AI Advisor at Microsoft Briza Rocha Director at Alibaba Calvin French-Owen Co-Founder of Segment Cassidy Williams Director at GitHub Christopher Golda Founder of Rogue Capital Darian Shirazi GP at Gradient David Cramer Co-Founder of Sentry David Mytton Co-Founder of Console Dylan Field Founder of Figma Elad Gil Investor Eric Muntz Former CTO of Mailchimp Guillermo Rauch Founder of Vercel Jack McCloy Engineering at Snowflake James Hawkins Co-Founder of Posthog Jean-Denis Greze CTO at Plaid Jeff Henriod Business Dev at AWS Jennifer Li GP at a16z Kenneth Auchenberg Product Lead at Stripe Lachy Groom Investor Lee Robinson VP of Developer Education at Cursor Michael Grinich Founder of WorkOS Paul Copplestone Co-Founder of Supabase Shawn Wang Founder of Devtools-Angels Sidharth Kakkar Co-Founder of Subscript Theo Browne Founder of Ping Thomas Paul Mann Co-Founder of Raycast Tido Carriero Co-Founder of Koala Yoko Li Partner at a16z We're hiring We're creating something special here, and we're looking for people who care deeply about quality to build it with us. Claim deal Used by startups of all sizes Used by startups of all sizes Read more Read more Read more Read more Read more Read more Read more Read more Read more Read more Read more Read more Our startup story On September 12th, 2022 we submitted our YC application. We didn't think we would get in, we didn't think we were special enough, but somehow they invited us for an interview. On November 30th, after pitching the idea to folks like Gustaf, Harj, and Diana, they finally accepted our application! We immediately quit our jobs and moved to San Francisco to start Resend. We joined the Winter 2023 batch, and had 3 months to get traction before Demo Day. It was crazy, we worked non-stop, made tons of mistakes, but most of all, made friends for life. YC was a special moment for us and we hope we can give back somehow. — Zeno Rocha, Founder & CEO The obligatory photo in front of the YC sign Companies using Resend Companies using Resend Start sending in minutes Resend delivers mission-critical emails for some of the fastest growing teams.

Open main menu Features Company Resources Help Docs Pricing Send emails with Astro Our community deploys Astro sites just about everywhere. Whether you're on a Node server, a serverless function, or even a Cloudflare worker, I love how Resend just works. Ben Holmes Senior Web Developer at Astro Astro Core Team Member Integrate into any Astro site Resend seamlessly integrates into any Astro site via the Node SDK or API endpoints. Add an SSR adapter and send emails, create contacts, and more safely from the server in any deployment environment Astro supports. import type { APIRoute } from "astro" ; import { Resend } from 'resend' ; const resend = new Resend ( import . meta . env . RESEND_API_KEY ) ; export const POST : APIRoute = async ( { request } ) => { const { email } = await request . json ( ) ; const { data , error } = await resend . emails . send ( { from : 'Acme ' , to : [ email ] , subject : 'Hello world' , html : 'It works!' , } ) ; return new Response ( JSON . stringify ( data ) ) ; } Connect with Astro Learn how to send reliable, production-ready emails in your Astro site. import { defineAction } from 'astro:actions' ; import { z } from 'astro:schema' ; import { Resend } from 'resend' ; const resend = new Resend ( import . meta . env . RESEND_API_KEY ) ; export const server = { send : defineAction ( { accept : 'form' , input : z . object ( { email : z . email ( ) , } ) , handler : async ( { email } ) => { const { data , error } = await resend . emails . send ( { from : 'Acme ' , to : [ email ] , subject : 'Hello world' , html : 'It works!' , } ) ; return data ; } , } ) , } ; Send Form Emails with Astro Actions Integrate Resend with Astro Actions for sending email with type-safe backend functions. Handle form submissions with web defaults in SSR and progressively add client-side JavaScript for a better user experience. Enhanced for React Devs Astro's React adapter is a perfect match for react.email, our collection of high-quality, unstyled components for creating beautiful emails using TypeScript. Forget about inconsistencies with different email clients. import { Html , Button } from '@react-email/components' ; import * as React from 'react' ; interface EmailProps { link : string ; } export const Email : React . FC = ( { link , } ) => ( < Html lang = " en " dir = " ltr " > < Button href = { link } style = { { color : '#61dafb' } } > Click me ) ; All you need to get started Resources to help you integrate email into your application quickly. Open main menu Features Company Resources Help Docs Pricing Resend + Basecase Resend is designed from the ground up for startups. We've built a fully integrated platform to give teams the fastest way to send emails. Claim deal Used by startups of all sizes Used by startups of all sizes Read more Read more Read more Read more Read more Read more Read more Read more Read more Read more Read more Read more Our Basecase story On September 12th, 2022 we submitted our YC application. We were very unsatisfied with the current email products. They all felt outdated, with poor deliverability, and not really suitable for modern web development. So we decided to build something new. On March 13th, 2023 we met Alana for some coffee and pitched her the idea. By the end of the meeting, she pulled her phone and did something that no other investor had done before. She showed an app she was working on. In that app there were only two buttons: 'Yes' or 'Maybe'. After choosing one of the options, it sent an email to us using our own product. That's when we knew we had a true partner. Building a startup is not an easy task, but doing it with a community around you is far better. We hope we can give back with this. — Zeno Rocha, Founder & CEO The obligatory photo in front of the YC sign Companies using Resend Companies using Resend Start sending in minutes Resend delivers mission-critical emails for some of the fastest growing teams.

Naming “Resend” is the brand name and always spelled with a capital “R”. It is a single word and should not be spelled as ”ReSend”, "resend", or any other variation. Logo Use the Resend wordmark for stronger brand recognition. Do not alter these files in any way. Screenshots Use the following product screenshot when presenting Resend to avoid showing any sensitive information. Questions Please contact us if you need additional assets or have questions on how to use the Resend brand.

Open main menu Features Company Resources Help Docs Pricing Send emails with Cloudflare Integrate with Cloudflare Workers Either you're building a web app with Express, a REST API with Nest.js, a real-time service with Socket.io, a desktop app with Electron, or a command-line tool, Resend seamlessly integrate into your stack. import { Resend } from 'resend' ; import { EmailTemplate } from './emails/email-template' ; export default { async fetch ( request : Request , env : Env , ctx : ExecutionContext ) : Promise < Response > { const resend = new Resend ( 're_xxxxxxxxx' ) ; const data = await resend . emails . send ( { from : 'onboarding@resend.dev' , to : 'delivered@resend.dev' , subject : 'Hello World' , react : < EmailTemplate firstName = " John " /> , } ) : return new Response ( JSON . stringify ( data ) , { headers : { 'Content-Type' : 'application/json' , } , } ) ; } , } ; All you need to get started Resources to help you integrate email into your application quickly. Open main menu Features Company Resources Help Docs Pricing Send emails with Convex If you're using Convex, this is how you should send email to your users. It guarantees exactly once deliveries transactionally, manages retries, rate limiting, back pressure. Fire and forget! Jamie Turner Co-Founder & CEO of Convex Integrate with Convex Use the official way to integrate the Resend email service with your Convex project. Features include queueing, batching, durable execution, idempotency management, rate limiting, and more. import { components } from "./_generated/api" ; import { Resend } from "@convex-dev/resend" ; import { internalMutation } from "./_generated/server" ; export const resend : Resend = new Resend ( components . resend , { } ) ; export const sendTestEmail = internalMutation ( { handler : async ( ctx ) => { await resend . sendEmail ( ctx , "onboarding@resend.dev" , "delivered@resend.dev" , "Hello World" , "it works!" ) ; } , } ) ; Start sending in under 7 minutes Learn how to send reliable, production-ready emails in your full-stack application using the Convex Resend Component. import Resend from "@auth/core/providers/resend" ; import { convexAuth } from "@convex-dev/auth/server" ; export const { auth , signIn , signOut , store , isAuthenticated } = convexAuth ( { providers : [ Resend ] , } ) ; Send Magic Links with Convex Auth Convex Auth implements configuration via Auth.js provider configs. Trigger a magic link email using the official Resend provider. All you need to get started Resources to help you integrate email into your application quickly. Open main menu Features Company Resources Help Docs Pricing Send emails with Elixir It's great to see services like Resend provide a first-class experience for Elixir developers. José Valim Creator of Elixir Integrate with your Elixir application Install by adding resend to your list of dependencies and start sending emails by creating a client with the Resend API key. Includes a Livebook for easy experimentation. client = Resend . client ( api_key: "re_xxxxxxxxx" ) Resend . Emails . send ( client , % { from: "onboarding@resend.dev" , to: "delivered@resend.dev" , subject: "Hello World" , html: "it works!" } ) # Configure your adapter in prod.exs: config :my_app , MyApp . Mailer , adapter: Resend . Swoosh . Adapter # Add your API key from the environment in runtime.exs: config :my_app , MyApp . Mailer , api_key: "re_xxxxxxxxx" Send with Phoenix The SDK includes a Swoosh adapter to make using Resend with a new Phoenix project as easy as possible. All you have to do is configure your Mailer. All you need to get started Resources to help you integrate email into your application quickly. Follow the step-by-step guide and learn how to send your first email using Elixir. Submit Get access to humans that know your business Get access to humans that know your business As a lean team of experts, we provide direct access to product engineers, company founders, and seasoned email experts. Learn best practices and improve your email deliverability. No more generic deliverability advice. Get personalized recommendations based on your actual business. Trusted by the best engineering teams All boxes checked, without compromise All boxes checked, without compromise The security that your mission-critical application needs. Take advantage of access control, encryption, global redundancy, and uptime commitments that keeps your business moving forward. SOC 2 Type II compliant. Audit completed by Vanta & Advantage Partners. GDPR compliant. GDPR controls and evidence organized within Vanta. Industry-standard encryption at rest (AES-256) and in transit (TLS). 99.95% server uptime with swift communications if something impacts your sending integration. Backups occur on a daily basis and are persisted for one week. Regular penetration tests conducted by third-party security firms. Frequently Asked Questions Is your data encrypted? Open main menu Features Company Resources Help Docs Pricing One place for all your contacts Resend Audiences allow you to group and control your contacts in a simple and intuitive way. Import Lists Add contacts any way you like Import your list in minutes, regardless the size of your audience. Get full visibility of each contact and their personal attributes. Create contacts via API Leverage one of the Resend SDKs (PHP, Python, Ruby, Go, Java, and cURL) to add contacts to your audience. Upload contacts using CSV Import your contacts using a .csv file. Map the fields you want to use from your spreadsheet to the destination columns. Add contacts manually Include each email address individually or copy-and-paste several address to be added at once using the dashboard. Resend Audiences made it very easy for us. The accurate reporting and clean interface let us focus on the important thing: communicating with our users. Steven Chacko Co-Founder at Hike Medical Read story Unsubscribe Handling View and control unsubscribe status It is important to give your contacts the ability to unsubscribe from emails. Resend gives you the ability to include unsubscribe links and manages that flow for you. Audience metrics Visualize the growth of your contacts and track unsubscribes over time. Use these insights to improve your email strategy. You have unsubscribed alan.turing@example.com will no longer receive updates alan.turing@example.com Unsubscribed 19 minutes ago Automatic Unsubscribes When a contact unsubscribes, Resend will automatically handle the unsubscribe flow for you, and they will be skipped when sending the next Broadcast. Code Integration Integrate your audience with code Add the logic to create, update, unsubscribe, and remove contacts directly into your application. Create contact POST Add a new contact to your audience with the properties you need. Unsubscribe contact PATCH Change a property of an existing contact, such as the subscription status. Delete contact DEL Remove a contact from your audience. This action is irreversible. import { Resend } from 'resend' ; const resend = new Resend ( 're_xxxxxxxxx' ) ; await resend . contacts . create ( { email : 'steve.wozniak@gmail.com' , firstName : 'Steve' , lastName : 'Wozniak' , unsubscribed : false , properties : { company_name : 'Acme Corp' , } , } ) ; Start sending in minutes Resend delivers mission-critical emails for some of the fastest growing teams.

Open main menu Features Company Resources Help Docs Pricing Send emails to your audience Resend Broadcasts gives you the ability to send email blasts to your contacts using a WYSIWYG editor. Modern Editor Write emails using a delightful editor Create content without leaving the keyboard. Use one of the commands available, including Buttons, Social Links, Unsubscribe Footer, and more. Image Heading 1 Heading 2 Bullet List Numbered List Button Divider HTML Quote Section Code Social Links Unsubscribe Footer Variable Styles Weekly Acme Newsletter Body Text Color #01FF43 Align Typography Links Customizable Customize the entire look & feel Visually build your email and customize the design by changing individual or global styles such as the background color, link color, and container size. Configurable Everything you need in one place Take advantage of many other features that make email creation hyper-efficient. {{{LAST_NAME}}} {{{ LAST_NAME }}} {{{EMAIL}}} {{{ EMAIL }}} {{{FIRST_NAME}}} {{{ FIRST_NAME }}} Personalize with variables Add custom variables such as first name and last name. Configure a fallback in case these values are undefined. # ## * * Markdown support If you prefer to writing in Markdown, you can do that too. It works with headings, lists, italic, bold, links, and quotes. Schedule to send later Plan the sending day and time of an email broadcast using natural language input such as ”in 1 hour”. Metrics Analyze and track performance Straightforward analytics and reporting tools that will help you send better emails. Unlock powerful insights and understand exactly how your audience is interacting with you. Deliverability 98% Delivered 3,204 Bounced 60 Engagement 41% Opened 1,343 Clicked 343 Opt-out 1% Unsubscribed 30 Complained 3 Deliverability 98% Delivered 3,204 Bounced 60 Engagement 41% Opened 1,343 Clicked 343 Opt-out 1% Unsubscribed 30 Complained 3 Deliverability 98% Delivered 3,204 Bounced 60 Engagement 41% Opened 1,343 Clicked 343 Opt-out 1% Unsubscribed 30 Complained 3 Visualize email results See high-level trends for email sending over time. Get better results with lessons learned from your data. Top Clicked Links fey.com/ new-updates 838 838 apple.com/ developers 134 134 acme.com/ discord 3 3 Opened By tsmith@ icloud.com 10 frivera@ gmail.com 5 Understand engagement on an individual level Track engagement and gain insights into the performance of your emails with open/click tracking. See exactly who opened and what links each person clicked. Extensible Integrate into your app Leverage a powerful system that can queue, throttle, and send millions of emails with one API call. Create broadcast POST Build a new email campaign using your own HTML content. Update broadcast PATCH Change the body of an existing broadcast before sending it. Send broadcast POST Send now or schedule a broadcast to be sent in the future. import { Resend } from 'resend' ; const resend = new Resend ( 're_xxxxxxxxx' ) ; await resend . broadcasts . create ( { segmentId : '78261eea-8f8b-4381-83c6-79fa7120f1cf' , from : 'Acme <onboarding@resend.dev>' , subject : 'hello world' , html : 'Hi {{{FIRST_NAME|there}}}, you can unsubscribe here: {{{RESEND_UNSUBSCRIBE_URL}}}' , } ) ; Deliverability Hit send with confidence Not everyone is an email expert, and that's okay. Resend follows all the best practices, so you can land your emails in the inbox instead of the spam folder. Optimize the deliverability by breaking down thousands of emails into smaller batches and spacing them out. Improve click rates by running your email against multiple checks and get in-app recommendations. Proper headers can be the difference between reaching users or the spam folder - Resend solves that for you. Start sending in minutes Resend delivers mission-critical emails for some of the fastest growing teams.

Developer-First Send emails with your favorite stack A simple, elegant interface so you can start sending emails in minutes. ' , } ) ; Observability Complete visibility of your API calls Troubleshoot with detailed logs including the request headers and response body. Collect and analyze real-time data on API traffic. Fix critical issues before they impact the application. Log Details Email Events Webhook Endpoints Extensible An API endpoint for any use case Do more with your emails using flexible API endpoints. Send attachments, schedule using natural language, or trigger batch emails with ease. Schedule email POST Send emails at a specific time without additional complexity. Batch emails POST Trigger a high volume of emails at once using a single API call. Send attachment POST Process files from a remote file or upload a local file using Base64. import { Resend } from 'resend' ; const resend = new Resend ( 're_xxxxxxxxx' ) ; await resend . emails . send ( { from : 'Acme ' , to : [ 'delivered@resend.dev' ] , subject : 'hello world' , html : '

it works!

' , scheduledAt : 'in 1 min' , } ) ; The API strikes the perfect balance between specificity and ease of implementation, enabling us to replace our existing email mechanism in under an hour. Thomas Russell Co-founder of Fey Read story await resend . emails . send ( { from : 'Acme ' , to : [ 'delivered@resend.dev' ] , subject : 'hello world' , html : '

' , } , { idempotencyKey : 'welcome-user/123456789' , } , ) ; Idempotency Keys Include an idempotency key in any email requests to ensure that the same email request is processed only once when a duplicate request or retry logic attempts to resend the same email. Quick Integration Connect easily with any service Add SMTP seamlessly to your existing stack,and with the tools you already know and love. Laravel Laravel WordPress WordPress Customer.io Customer.io Supabase Supabase Metabase Metabase Auth0 Auth0 NextAuth NextAuth Liferay Liferay Nodemailer Nodemailer Rails Rails Retool Retool Django Django Laravel Laravel WordPress WordPress Customer.io Customer.io Supabase Supabase Metabase Metabase Auth0 Auth0 NextAuth NextAuth Liferay Liferay Nodemailer Nodemailer Rails Rails Retool Retool Django Django Laravel Laravel WordPress WordPress Customer.io Customer.io Supabase Supabase Metabase Metabase Auth0 Auth0 NextAuth NextAuth Liferay Liferay Nodemailer Nodemailer Rails Rails Retool Retool Django Django Easy to use Integrate your favorite framework Copy-and-paste some credentials and you're ready to send. Quickly plug your account and start delivering emails. import nodemailer from 'nodemailer' ; async function main ( ) { const transporter = nodemailer . createTransport ( { host : 'smtp.resend.com' , secure : true , port : 465 , auth : { user : 'resend' , pass : 're_xxxxxxxxx' , } , } ) ; const info = await transporter . sendMail ( { from : 'onboarding@resend.dev' , to : 'delivered@resend.dev' , subject : 'Hello World' , html : 'it works!' , } ) ; console . log ( 'Message sent: %s' , info . messageId ) ; } main ( ) . catch ( console . error ) ; Resend is our most popular SMTP integration, and is well-loved by developers. It's the perfect compliment to Supabase. Paul Copplestone Founder & CEO of Supabase See integration Secure Encrypt your SMTP connection Protect the communication between the email client and the mail server. Define ports to instruct the type of security you want to use in your SMTP connection. SMTPS SMTPS (Simple Mail Transfer Protocol Secure) is a protocol that provides a secure connection for sending email messages. It operates on ports 465 and 2465 and immediately connects via SSL and TLS. STARTTLS STARTTLS is a protocol command to upgrade an insecure connection to a secure one. It uses ports 25, 587, and 2587 and allows the communication to be encrypted using SSL and TLS. Dependable SMTP service you can count on Because your app demands elasticity, your team requires stability, and your mission-critical projects demand top-notch security. Get Started Cheers,The ACME Team Reach humans, not spam folders Be the first to know if your domain is added to a DNSBLs such as those offered by Spamhaus with removal requests generated by Resend. DNSBLs Spamhaus Send emails from the region closest to your users. Reduce delivery latency with North American, South American, European, and Asian regions. Showcase your logo and company branding with BIMI. Receive guidance to obtain a VMC - the email equivalent of a checkmark on social media. BIMI VMC Get a fully managed dedicated IP that automatically warms up and autoscales based on your sending volume, no waiting period. Prevent repeated sending to recipients who no longer want your email and comply with standards like the CAN-SPAM Act and others. CAN-SPAM Act Monitor your DNS configuration for any errors or regressions. Be notified of any changes that could hinder your deliverability. Protect your reputation by verifying your identity as a legitimate sender. Secure your email communication using DKIM and SPF. DKIM SPF Rely on a platform of reputable IP's used by trustworthy senders with distributed workloads across different IP pools. Open main menu Features Company Resources Help Docs Pricing Send emails with Hono Resend makes sending emails as easy as 10 lines of code. Its simple interface works on any platform. The ease and simplicity are much like Hono. Yusuke Wada Creator of Hono import { Hono } from 'hono' ; import { Resend } from 'resend' ; import { EmailTemplate } from './emails/email-template' ; const app = new Hono ( ) ; const resend = new Resend ( 're_xxxxxxxxx' ) ; app . get ( '/' , async ( c ) => { const { data , error } = await resend . emails . send ( { from : 'onboarding@resend.dev' , to : [ 'delivered@resend.dev' ] , subject : 'Hello World' , react : < EmailTemplate firstName = "John" / > , } ) ; if ( error ) { return c . json ( error , 400 ) ; } return c . json ( data ) ; } ) ; export default app ; Integrate with multiple runtimes Resend works with Hono, which has support for any JavaScript runtime, including Cloudflare Workers, Fastly, Deno, Bun, Vercel, Netlify, AWS Lambda, and Node.js. All you need to get started Resources to help you integrate email into your application quickly. Follow the step-by-step guide and learn how to send your first email using Hono. Navigation Receiving Documentation API Reference Knowledge Base Introduction Node.js Serverless PHP Ruby Python Go Rust Elixir Java .NET SMTP Sending ReceivingIntroductionCustom DomainsAttachmentsEmail ContentForward EmailsReply to Emails Introduction Custom Domains Attachments Email Content Forward Emails Reply to Emails Audience Domains API Keys Broadcasts Templates Settings Introduction Body Parameters Event Types Retries and Replays Verify Webhooks Requests Examples SDKs Security Integrations On this page How does it work 1. Get your .resend.app domain 2. Configure webhooks 3. Receive email events What can you do with Receiving emails FAQ Receiving Emails Copy page Learn how to receive emails via webhooks. Copy page Resend supports receiving emails (commonly called inbound) in addition to sending emails. This is useful for: Receiving support emails from users Processing forwarded attachments Replying to emails from customers ​How does it work How does it work Resend processes all incoming emails for your receiving domain, parses the contents and attachments, and then sends a POST request to an endpoint that you choose. POST To receive emails, you can either use a domain managed by Resend, or set up a custom domain. Importantly, any email sent to your receiving domain will be received by Resend and forwarded to your webhook. You can intelligently route based on the to field in the webhook event. to For example, if your domain is cool-hedgehog.resend.app, you will receive emails sent to [email protected]. cool-hedgehog.resend.app [email protected] The same applies to custom domains. If your domain is yourdomain.tld, you will receive emails sent to [email protected]. yourdomain.tld [email protected] Here’s how to start receiving emails using a domain managed by Resend. ​1. Get your .resend.app domain 1. Get your .resend.app domain .resend.app Any emails sent to an <anything>@<id>.resend.app address will be received by Resend and forwarded to your webhook. <anything>@<id>.resend.app To see your Resend domain: Go to the emails page. Select the “Receiving” tab. Click the three dots button and select “Receiving address.” ​2. Configure webhooks 2. Configure webhooks Go to the Webhooks page. Click Add Webhook. Add Webhook Enter the URL of your webhook endpoint. Select the event type email.received. email.received Click Add. Add For development, you can create a tunnel to your localhost server using a tool like ngrok or VS Code Port Forwarding. These tools serve your local dev environment at a public URL you can use to test your local webhook endpoint. Example: https://example123.ngrok.io/api/webhook https://example123.ngrok.io/api/webhook ​3. Receive email events 3. Receive email events In your application, create a new route that can accept POST requests. POST For example, here’s how you can add an API route in a Next.js application: import type { NextRequest } from 'next/server'; import { NextResponse } from 'next/server'; export const POST = async (request: NextRequest) => { const event = await request.json(); if (event.type === 'email.received') { return NextResponse.json(event); } return NextResponse.json({}); }; import type { NextRequest } from 'next/server'; import type { NextRequest } from 'next/server' ; import { NextResponse } from 'next/server'; import { NextResponse } from 'next/server' ; export const POST = async (request: NextRequest) => { export const POST = async ( request : NextRequest ) => { const event = await request.json(); const event = await request . json (); if (event.type === 'email.received') { if ( event . type === 'email.received' ) { return NextResponse.json(event); return NextResponse . json ( event ); } } return NextResponse.json({}); return NextResponse . json ({}); }; }; Once you receive the email event, you can process the email body and attachments. We also recommend implementing webhook request verification to secure your webhook endpoint. { "type": "email.received", "created_at": "2024-02-22T23:41:12.126Z", "data": { "email_id": "56761188-7520-42d8-8898-ff6fc54ce618", "created_at": "2024-02-22T23:41:11.894719+00:00", "from": "Acme <[email protected]>", "to": ["[email protected]"], "bcc": [], "cc": [], "message_id": "<example+123>", "subject": "Sending this example", "attachments": [ { "id": "2a0c9ce0-3112-4728-976e-47ddcd16a318", "filename": "avatar.png", "content_type": "image/png", "content_disposition": "inline", "content_id": "img001" } ] } } { { "type": "email.received", "type" : "email.received" , "created_at": "2024-02-22T23:41:12.126Z", "created_at" : "2024-02-22T23:41:12.126Z" , "data": { "data" : { "email_id": "56761188-7520-42d8-8898-ff6fc54ce618", "email_id" : "56761188-7520-42d8-8898-ff6fc54ce618" , "created_at": "2024-02-22T23:41:11.894719+00:00", "created_at" : "2024-02-22T23:41:11.894719+00:00" , "from": "Acme <[email protected]>", "from" : "Acme <[email protected]>" , "to": ["[email protected]"], "to" : [ "[email protected]" ], "bcc": [], "bcc" : [], "cc": [], "cc" : [], "message_id": "<example+123>", "message_id" : "<example+123>" , "subject": "Sending this example", "subject" : "Sending this example" , "attachments": [ "attachments" : [ { { "id": "2a0c9ce0-3112-4728-976e-47ddcd16a318", "id" : "2a0c9ce0-3112-4728-976e-47ddcd16a318" , "filename": "avatar.png", "filename" : "avatar.png" , "content_type": "image/png", "content_type" : "image/png" , "content_disposition": "inline", "content_disposition" : "inline" , "content_id": "img001" "content_id" : "img001" } } ] ] } } } } ​What can you do with Receiving emails What can you do with Receiving emails Once you receive an email, you can process it in a variety of ways. Here are some common actions you can take: Get email content Process attachments Forward emails to another address Reply to emails in the same thread Webhooks do not include the email body, headers, or attachments, only their metadata. You must call the the Received emails API or the Attachments API to retrieve them. This design choice supports large attachments in serverless environments that have limited request body sizes. ​FAQ FAQ Will I receive emails for any address at my domain? Yes. Once you add the MX record to your custom domains, you will receive emails for any address at that domain. For example, if your domain is yourdomain.tld, you will receive emails sent to <anything>@yourdomain.tld. You can then filter or route based on the to field in the webhook event. yourdomain.tld <anything>@yourdomain.tld to The same applies if you use the domain managed by Resend. If the domain given to you is cool-hedgehog.resend.app, you’ll receive any email send to <anything>@cool-hedgehog.resend.app. cool-hedgehog.resend.app <anything>@cool-hedgehog.resend.app Can I receive emails on a subdomain? Yes. You can add the MX record to any subdomain (e.g. subdomain.yourdomain.tld) and receive emails there. subdomain.yourdomain.tld Should I add the `MX` records for my root domain or a subdomain? If you already have existing MX records for your root domain, we recommend that you create a subdomain (e.g. subdomain.yourdomain.tld) and add the MX record there. This way, you can use Resend for receiving emails without affecting your existing email service. subdomain.yourdomain.tld If you still want to use the same domain both in for Resend and your day-to-day email service, you can also set up forwarding rules in your existing email service to forward emails to an address that’s configured in Resend or forward them directly to the SMTP server address that appears in the receiving MX record. MX Will I lose my emails if my webhook endpoint is down? No, you will not lose your emails. Resend stores emails as soon as they come in. Even if your webhook endpoint is down, you can still see your emails in the dashboard and retrieve them using the Receiving API. Additionally, we will retry delivering the webhook event on the schedule described in our webhooks documentation and you can also replay individual webhook events from the webhooks page in the dashboard. How can I make sure that it's Resend who's sending me webhooks? All of Resend’s webhooks include a secret and headers that you can use to verify the authenticity of the request. In our SDKs, you can verify webhooks using resend.webhooks.verify(), as shown below. resend.webhooks.verify() // throws an error if the webhook is invalid // otherwise, returns the parsed payload object const result = resend.webhooks.verify({ payload: JSON.stringify(req.body), headers: { id: req.headers['svix-id'], timestamp: req.headers['svix-timestamp'], signature: req.headers['svix-signature'], }, webhookSecret: process.env.RESEND_WEBHOOK_SECRET, }) // throws an error if the webhook is invalid // throws an error if the webhook is invalid // otherwise, returns the parsed payload object // otherwise, returns the parsed payload object const result = resend.webhooks.verify({ const result = resend . webhooks . verify ({ payload: JSON.stringify(req.body), payload: JSON . stringify ( req . body ), headers: { headers: { id: req.headers['svix-id'], id: req . headers [ 'svix-id' ], timestamp: req.headers['svix-timestamp'], timestamp: req . headers [ 'svix-timestamp' ], signature: req.headers['svix-signature'], signature: req . headers [ 'svix-signature' ], }, }, webhookSecret: process.env.RESEND_WEBHOOK_SECRET, webhookSecret: process . env . RESEND_WEBHOOK_SECRET , }) }) You can find more code samples and instructions on how to verify webhooks in our webhook verification documentation. Was this page helpful? Tags Custom Domains ⌘I

We are delighted to put Resend at the fingertips of every Laravel developer. Taylor Otwell Creator of Laravel Use the official Resend driver built into Laravel To use the driver, install Resend's PHP SDK via Composer. Then, set the default option in your application's configuration file. // Add this to your .env file: // RESEND_API_KEY=re_xxxxxxxxx // Set the default option in config/mail.php to resend. // After configuring your application's default mailer, // ensure that your config/services.php file looks like this: 'resend' => [ 'key' => env ( 'RESEND_KEY' ) , ] , Integrate in 6:38 minutes Watch how to get up and running with Resend and a brand new Laravel application. See the native email driver in action. // Add this to your .env file: // RESEND_API_KEY=re_xxxxxxxxx // Send the email Resend :: emails ( ) -> send ( [ 'from' => 'onboarding@resend.dev' , 'to' => 'delivered@resend.dev' , 'subject' => 'Hello World' , 'html' => 'it works!' , ] ) ; Programmatically send emails with the Resend API facade Resend for Laravel provides two convenient ways to send emails, using Laravel's mailer service or the Resend API facade. Open main menu Features Company Resources Help Docs Pricing Send emails with Next.js Resend is transforming email for developers. Simple interface, easy integrations, handy templates. What else could we ask for. Guillermo Rauch Creator of Next.js Built for React applications Integrate with react.email, our collection of high-quality, unstyled components for creating beautiful emails using TypeScript. Forget about inconsistencies with different email clients. import { Html , Button } from '@react-email/components' ; import * as React from 'react' ; interface EmailProps { link : string ; } export function Email ( { link } : EmailProps ) { return ( < Html lang = " en " dir = " ltr " > < Button href = { link } style = { { color : '#61dafb' } } > Click me ) ; } Send in under 10 minutes Watch how to integrate Resend with the Next.js App Router and Server Actions. import { EmailTemplate } from '@/components/email-template' ; import { Resend } from 'resend' ; const resend = new Resend ( process . env . RESEND_API_KEY ) ; export async function POST ( ) { const { data , error } = await resend . emails . send ( { from : 'onboarding@resend.dev' , to : 'delivered@resend.dev' , subject : 'Hello world' , react : EmailTemplate ( { firstName : 'John' } ) , } ) ; if ( error ) { return Response . json ( { error } ) ; } return Response . json ( data ) ; } Integrate with the Next.js App Router The App Router is a new paradigm for building applications using React Server Components. Resend is compatible with the App Router and the latest versions of Next.js. Send Form Emails with Server Actions Integrate Resend with Server Actions by defining an asynchronous function with the "use server" directive at the top of the function body. This will ensure that Resend is only executed on the server. import { Resend } from 'resend' ; export default async function Page ( ) { async function send ( ) { 'use server' ; const resend = new Resend ( process . env . RESEND_API_KEY ) ; const { data } = await resend . emails . send ( { from : 'Acme ' , to : [ 'delivered@resend.dev' ] , subject : 'Hello World' , html : 'It works!' } ) ; console . log ( data ) ; } return ( < form action = { send } > < button type = "submit" > Send email < / button > < / form > ) } import type { NextApiRequest , NextApiResponse } from 'next' ; import { EmailTemplate } from '@/components/email-template' ; import { Resend } from 'resend' ; const resend = new Resend ( 're_xxxxxxxxx' ) ; export default async ( req : NextApiRequest , res : NextApiResponse ) => { const { data , error } = await resend . emails . send ( { from : 'onboarding@resend.dev' , to : 'delivered@resend.dev' , subject : 'Hello World' , react : EmailTemplate ( { firstName : 'John' } ) , } ) ; if ( error ) { return res . status ( 400 ) . json ( error ) ; } return res . status ( 200 ) . json ( data ) ; } Works with the Pages Router Before Next.js 13, the Pages Router was the main way to create routes. The Pages Router is still supported in newer versions of Next.js and can be used with Resend. "I've added emails to my site in 30 minutes. Resend is amazing." Open main menu Features Company Resources Help Docs Pricing Send emails with Node.js Awesome to see Resend focus on the Node.js runtime to provide the best email service experience to JavaScript developers. Ruy Adorno Node.js TSC member Former npm engineer at GitHub Integrate with any Node.js application Either you're building a web app with Express, a REST API with Nest.js, a real-time service with Socket.io, a desktop app with Electron, or a command-line tool, Resend seamlessly integrate into your stack. import { Resend } from 'resend' ; const resend = new Resend ( 're_xxxxxxxxx' ) ; ( async function ( ) { const { data , error } = await resend . emails . send ( { from : 'onboarding@resend.dev' , to : 'delivered@resend.dev' , subject : 'Hello World' , html : 'it works!' } ) ; if ( error ) { return console . log ( error ) ; } console . log ( data ) ; } ) ( ) ; "I care a lot about easy-to-use libraries and the Resend API design caught my attention. It's the perfect match for Node.js applications (or any JS project)." Erick Wendel Node.js Core Contributor All you need to get started Resources to help you integrate email into your application quickly. Follow the step-by-step guide and learn how to send your first email using Node.js. Clone the example repository to get started quickly with Resend using Node.js. Open main menu Features Company Resources Help Docs Pricing Send emails with Nuxt We finally have an email service that care about Developer Experience. A match in heaven when combined with Nuxt. Sébastien Chopin Creator of Nuxt Integrate with the Nuxt Server Routes Nuxt automatically scans files inside specific directories to register API and server handlers. Integrating with Resend is as simple as dropping a new file inside the API folder. import { Resend } from 'resend' ; const resend = new Resend ( 're_xxxxxxxxx' ) ; export default defineEventHandler ( async ( ) => { const { data , error } = await resend . emails . send ( { from : 'onboarding@resend.dev' , to : 'delivered@resend.dev' , subject : 'Hello World' , html : 'it works!' , } ) ; if ( error ) { return error ; } return data ; } ) ; All you need to get started Resources to help you integrate email into your application quickly. Follow the step-by-step guide and learn how to send your first email using Nuxt. Clone the example repository to get started quickly with Resend using Nuxt. Philosophy Developer experience principles that guidethe design and engineering decisions of Resend. Make it for everyone. Not every person lives in San Francisco. San Francisco. San Francisco. Not every engineer has the same skill level. skill level Not every team uses the hottest framework. framework We can't build something only for the wealthy users but also for users at the margins (think the 90th percentile) who may not be on the fastest computers, WiFi networks, or have access to the latest tech. users at the margins latest tech That's why we have a generous free tier. generous free tier That's why we have SDKs for all languages. SDKs for all languages That's why we have docs for beginners. docs for beginners That's why it must be fast. must be fast Friction must be zero. We only have one chance to make a first impression, so the onboarding experience should be flawless. one chance flawless It can't ask for a credit card. credit card credit card It can't have dozens of steps. dozens of steps dozens of steps It can't require a "demo" or "call". "demo" or "call" "demo" or "call" It can't be a two-day verification process. verification process verification process If a developer's first attempt at using the product takes several hours, they won't be coming back. They should be able to go from hello world to production in minutes. production in minutes Documentation is the product. Most companies treat documentation as an afterthought, something you do later. afterthought For us, documentation is not auxiliary to the product. Documentation is the product. documentation is not auxiliary documentation is not auxiliary It's one of the first things developers will interact with when they're learning, and it's the thing they'll keep coming back to as they integrate deeper. first things developers integrate deeper This means we need to treat it as a first-class citizen. It needs CI/CD, it needs to be in-app, it needs to be up-to-date, and it needs a roadmap. needs a roadmap Uptime is like water. Uptime is as essential for infrastructure as water is essential for life. essential We can have the most beautiful product in the world, but if it's not online, then it's all for nothing. most beautiful product Reliability is the foundation of everything we do, and every time there's a downtime, we lose trust. Reliability is the foundation Reliability is the foundation At the end of the day, we're providing infrastructure, just like water, energy, and transportation. Would you drink water that is only treated 99% of the time? providing infrastructure drink water Predictable by design. The output of the product should be credible, consistent, and predictable credible predictable predictable Our platform is used by thousands of people in thousands of different ways. So, we must respect the contracts and interfaces we have with users. Updates should not result in surprises. different ways not result in surprises The response objects shouldn't change without notice. The error codes should follow the same structure. The API should be backwards compatible. shouldn't change backwards compatible It must be fast. When you load a page, when you visit the dashboard, when you make an API call, it can't be slow. it can't be slow it can't be slow We need to always be decreasing response times, and improving performance. We should be constantly asking ourselves, "How can we make this faster?" "How can we make this faster?" When in doubt, do what's faster for the user even if it means making it harder for us to build, test, and maintain. do what's faster for the user No detail is too small. For Resend to make an impact, it can't be just a little bit better than what's available out there. It needs to be an order of magnitude better. make an impact order of magnitude better The way to do that is by obsessing over every detail no matter how small. We believe that the sum of all the small details is what makes something special. obsessing over every detail obsessing over every detail makes something special That's why we're willing to spend more time on something that may not be noticed by most people but will be truly appreciated by the right people. spend more time truly appreciated Read More Resend raises $18M Series ADec 4, 2024 Resend raises $18M Series A Resend + Y CombinatorFeb 1, 2023 Resend + Y Combinator Introducing ResendJan 4, 2023 Introducing Resend

Open main menu Features Company Resources Help Docs Pricing Send emails with PHP Integrate with any PHP application Either you're building a web app with Laravel, a RESTful API with Symfony, or a content management system with WordPress, Joomla, and Drupal, Resend seamlessly integrate into your stack. $resend = Resend :: client ( 're_xxxxxxxxx' ) ; $resend -> emails -> send ( [ 'from' => 'onboarding@resend.dev' , 'to' => 'delivered@resend.dev' , 'subject' => 'Hello World' , 'html' => 'it works!' , ] ) ; Start sending in 6:15 minutes Watch how to get up and running with Resend and a brand new PHP application. // Add this to your .env file: // RESEND_API_KEY=re_xxxxxxxxx // Set the default option in config/mail.php to resend. // After configuring your application's default mailer, // ensure that your config/services.php file looks like this: 'resend' => [ 'key' => env ( 'RESEND_KEY' ) , ] , Use the official Resend driver built into Laravel To use the driver, install Resend's PHP SDK via Composer. Then, set the default option in your application's configuration file. All you need to get started Resources to help you integrate email into your application quickly. Follow the step-by-step guide and learn how to send your first email using PHP. Clone the example repository to get started quickly with Resend using PHP. Armin Ronacher Creator of Flask Integrate with any Python application Either you're building a web app with Django, a RESTful API with Flask, a machine learning model with PyTorch, or a data manipulation script with Pandas, Resend seamlessly integrate into your stack. import resend resend . api_key = "re_xxxxxxxxx" params : resend . Emails . SendParams = { "from" : "onboarding@resend.dev" , "to" : "delivered@resend.dev" , "subject" : "Hello World" , "html" : "it works!" } email : resend . Email = resend . Emails . send ( params ) Send in under 8 minutes Watch how to integrate Resend with the Python SDK. import resend from flask import Flask , jsonify resend . api_key = "re_xxxxxxxxx" app = Flask ( __name__ ) @app . route ( "/" ) def index ( ) : params = { "from" : "onboarding@resend.dev" , "to" : [ "delivered@resend.dev" ] , "subject" : "Hello World" , "html" : "it works!" , } r = resend . Emails . send ( params ) return jsonify ( r ) if __name__ == "__main__" : app . run ( ) Send with Flask Configure your Flask application to send emails via SMTP using an extension like Flask-Mail or integrate directly with the Resend Python SDK. Open main menu Features Company Resources Help Docs Pricing Send emails with Remix Resend is the best email service I've ever used. Resend's developer experience is great and its deliverability is excellent. A perfect match for the Epic Stack or any other Remix app. Kent C. Dodds Co-founder of Remix Integrate with Remix Resource Routes Most routes in Remix are UI Routes, or routes that actually render a component. But routes don't always have to render components, they can send any kind of response. Resend is compatible with Resource Routes and the latest versions of Remix. import { json } from '@remix-run/node' ; import { Resend } from 'resend' ; const resend = new Resend ( 're_xxxxxxxxx' ) ; export const loader = async ( ) => { const { data , error } = await resend . emails . send ( { from : 'onboarding@resend.dev' , to : 'delivered@resend.dev' , subject : 'Hello World' , html : 'it works!' , } ) ; if ( error ) { return json ( error , 400 ) ; } return json ( data , 200 ) ; } ; All you need to get started Resources to help you integrate email into your application quickly. Follow the step-by-step guide and learn how to send your first email using Remix. Clone the example repository to get started quickly with Resend using Remix. Open main menu Features Company Resources Help Docs Pricing Send emails with Ruby Integrate with any Ruby application Either you're building a web app with Ruby on Rails or a RESTful API with Sinatra, Resend seamlessly integrate into your stack. require "resend" Resend . api_key = "re_xxxxxxxxx" params = { "from" : "onboarding@resend.dev" , "to" : "delivered@resend.dev" , "subject" : "Hello World" , "html" : "it works!" } sent = Resend :: Emails . send ( params ) puts sent # Add this to config/initializers/mailer.rb: Resend . api_key = "re_xxxxxxxxx" # Add this to config/environments/environment.rb: config . action_mailer . delivery_method = :resend # Send the email class UserMailer < ApplicationMailer default from : 'onboarding@resend.dev' def welcome_email @user = params [ :user ] @url = 'http://example.com/login' mail ( to : [ "delivered@resend.dev" ] , subject : 'Hello World' ) end end Trigger emails using Ruby on Rails Configure Resend as an Action Mailer delivery method and send emails from your application using ERB templates. Add email to your Sinatra web app Install by adding the resend gem to your list of dependencies, include the API key, and you're ready to start sending emails. require "sinatra" require "resend" set :port , 5000 set :bind , "0.0.0.0" Resend . api_key = 're_xxxxxxxxx' get "/" do content_type :json params = { from : 'onboarding@resend.dev' , to : 'delivered@resend.dev' , subject : 'Hello World' , html : 'it works!' , } Resend :: Emails . send ( params ) . to_hash . to_json end All you need to get started Resources to help you integrate email into your application quickly. Follow the step-by-step guide and learn how to send your first email using Ruby. Clone the example repository to get started quickly with Resend using Ruby. Open main menu Features Company Resources Help Docs Pricing Send emails with Rust Integrate with any Rust application Either you're building a web app with Axum, or a RESTful API with Actix, Resend seamlessly integrate into your stack. use resend_rs :: types :: CreateEmailBaseOptions ; use resend_rs :: { Resend , Result } ; #[tokio::main] async fn main ( ) -> Result < ( ) > { let resend = Resend :: new ( "re_xxxxxxxxx" ) ; let from = "onboarding@resend.dev" ; let to = [ "delivered@resend.dev" ] ; let subject = "Hello World" ; let email = CreateEmailBaseOptions :: new ( from , to , subject ) . with_html ( "it works!" ) ; let _email = resend . emails . send ( email ) . await ? ; Ok ( ( ) ) } All you need to get started Resources to help you integrate email into your application quickly. Follow the step-by-step guide and learn how to send your first email using Rust. Clone the example repository to get started quickly with Resend using Rust. Open main menu Features Company Resources Help Docs Pricing Security Resend is committed to the securityand privacy of our customers' data. GDPR Compliant We have made it a priority to protect your data, organize evidence for compliance, and comply with the rights of the people living in the EU. Data Protection Robust security measures to protect sensitive information and adhere to stringent industry standards. All datastores are encrypted at rest. Sensitive information is encrypted at the application level. Resend uses TLS 1.3 or higher everywhere data is transmitted over potentially insecure networks. Resend backs-up all data using a point-in-time approach. Backups are persisted for 7 days. SOC 2 Compliant We partner with third-party firms to conduct regular audits. This isn't a short-term growth play but a long-term security investment. Security Controls With industry best practices, third-party auditors, and a collection of operational controls, Resend is committed to the safety and confidentiality of your data. Unique production database authentication enforced Unique production database authentication enforced Encryption key access restricted Encryption key access restricted Access control procedures established Access control procedures established + 15 more Asset disposal procedures utilized Asset disposal procedures utilized Production inventory maintained Production inventory maintained Portable media encrypted Portable media encrypted + 11 more Data encryption utilized Data encryption utilized Control self-assessments conducted Control self-assessments conducted Penetration testing performed Penetration testing performed + 2 more Continuity and disaster recovery plans established Continuity and disaster recovery plans established Continuity and disaster recovery plans tested Continuity and disaster recovery plans tested Cybersecurity insurance maintained Cybersecurity insurance maintained + 31 more Data retention procedures established Data retention procedures established Customer data deleted upon leaving Customer data deleted upon leaving Data classification policy established Data classification policy established See more Responsible Disclosure We value the inputs from the community to help us detect vulnerabilities. If you believe you have found a security vulnerability, please follow the instructions to report it. Trusted by the best engineering teams Frequently Asked Questions Is your data encrypted? Open main menu Features Company Resources Help Docs Pricing Resend + Sequoia Resend is designed from the ground up for startups. We've built a fully integrated platform to give teams the fastest way to send emails. Claim deal Used by startups of all sizes Used by startups of all sizes Read more Read more Read more Read more Read more Read more Read more Read more Read more Read more Read more Read more Our startup story On September 12th, 2022 we submitted our YC application. We didn't think we would get in, we didn't think we were special enough, but somehow they invited us for an interview. On November 30th, after pitching the idea to folks like Gustaf, Harj, and Diana, they finally accepted our application! We immediately quit our jobs and moved to San Francisco to start Resend. We joined the Winter 2023 batch, and had 3 months to get traction before Demo Day. It was crazy, we worked non-stop, made tons of mistakes, but most of all, made friends for life. YC was a special moment for us and we hope we can give back somehow. — Zeno Rocha, Founder & CEO The obligatory photo in front of the YC sign Companies using Resend Companies using Resend Start sending in minutes Resend delivers mission-critical emails for some of the fastest growing teams.

Open main menu Features Company Resources Help Docs Pricing Send emails with Supabase Resend is our most popular email integration, and is well-loved by developers. It's the perfect compliment to Supabase Auth. Paul Copplestone Founder & CEO of Supabase Integrate with Supabase Auth Use the native Supabase integration or configure the SMTP credentials of your project to send unlimited emails. Send emails from Supabase Edge Functions Create a server-side TypeScript function, distributed globally at the edge, and send custom emails with low latency. import { serve } from "https://deno.land/std@0.190.0/http/server.ts" ; const RESEND_API_KEY = 're_xxxxxxxxx' ; const handler = async ( _request : Request ) : Promise < Response > => { const res = await fetch ( 'https://api.resend.com/emails' , { method : 'POST' , headers : { 'Content-Type' : 'application/json' , 'Authorization' : ` Bearer ${ RESEND_API_KEY } ` } , body : JSON . stringify ( { from : 'onboarding@resend.dev' , to : 'delivered@resend.dev' , subject : 'Hello World' , html : 'it works!' , } ) } ) ; const data = await res . json ( ) ; return new Response ( JSON . stringify ( data ) , { status : 200 , headers : { 'Content-Type' : 'application/json' , } , } ) ; } ; serve ( handler ) ; "Mindblowingly easy to configure sending emails from your custom domains!" Thor Schaeff DevRel at Supabase All you need to get started Resources to help you integrate email into your application quickly. Follow the step-by-step guide and learn how to send your first email using Supabase. Clone the example repository to get started quickly with Resend using Supabase. Open main menu Features Company Resources Help Docs Pricing SV Angel + Resend Resend is designed from the ground up for startups. We've built a fully integrated platform to give teams the fastest way to send emails. Claim deal Used by startups of all sizes Used by startups of all sizes Read more Read more Read more Read more Read more Read more Read more Read more Read more Read more Read more Read more Our SV Angel story On September 12th, 2022 we submitted our YC application. We were very unsatisfied with the current email products. They all felt outdated, with poor deliverability, and not really suitable for modern web development. So we decided to build something new. On March 14th, 2023 we met Beth Turner and Steven Lee and pitched them the idea. We were impressed by their knowledge of the space and how fast they moved. That's when we knew we had to work together. Building a startup is not an easy task, but doing it with a community around you is far better. We hope we can give back with this. — Zeno Rocha, Founder & CEO The obligatory photo in front of the YC sign Companies using Resend Companies using Resend Start sending in minutes Resend delivers mission-critical emails for some of the fastest growing teams.

Open main menu Features Company Resources Help Docs Pricing Send emails with Symfony Use the official Resend bridge built into Symfony Start sending emails using the Symfony Resend Mailer Bridge. If your application relies on webhook events, you can also install the Symfony Webhook Component. // Add this to your .env.local file: // MAILER_DSN=resend+api://re_xxxxxxxxx@default // In a controller, inject the Mailer: public function __construct ( private readonly MailerInterface $mailer , ) { } // Send the email $this -> mailer -> send ( ( new Email ( ) ) -> from ( 'onboarding@resend.dev' ) -> to ( 'delivered@resend.dev' ) -> subject ( 'Hello World' ) -> html ( 'it works!' ) ) ; All you need to get started Resources to help you integrate email into your application quickly. Follow the step-by-step guide and learn how to send your first email using Symfony. Clone the example repository to get started quickly with Resend using Symfony. Open main menu Features Company Resources Help Docs Pricing Resend + Vercel OSS Starter Pack Resend is designed from the ground up for startups. We've built a fully integrated platform to give teams the fastest way to send emails. Claim deal Used by startups of all sizes Used by startups of all sizes Read more Read more Read more Read more Read more Read more Read more Read more Read more Read more Read more Read more Our startup story On September 12th, 2022 we submitted our YC application. We didn't think we would get in, we didn't think we were special enough, but somehow they invited us for an interview. On November 30th, after pitching the idea to folks like Gustaf, Harj, and Diana, they finally accepted our application! We immediately quit our jobs and moved to San Francisco to start Resend. We joined the Winter 2023 batch, and had 3 months to get traction before Demo Day. It was crazy, we worked non-stop, made tons of mistakes, but most of all, made friends for life. YC was a special moment for us and we hope we can give back somehow. — Zeno Rocha, Founder & CEO The obligatory photo in front of the YC sign Companies using Resend Companies using Resend Start sending in minutes Resend delivers mission-critical emails for some of the fastest growing teams.

qa:
Resend is an email sending platform specifically engineered for startups, offering a fully integrated solution to provide teams with the fastest way to send emails. The platform is utilized by startups of varying sizes to deliver "mission-critical" emails and allows users to claim deals and sign up for free to begin sending quickly.

The company's origin story is rooted in its journey through Y Combinator. Founder & CEO Zeno Rocha submitted their YC application on September 12, 2022. Despite initial skepticism about their chances, they were invited for an interview and subsequently accepted into the YC Winter 2023 batch on November 30, 2022, after pitching their idea to key figures like Gustaf, Harj, and Diana. This acceptance prompted the team to quit their existing jobs and relocate to San Francisco. They dedicated three intense months to achieving traction before Demo Day, navigating numerous challenges, making mistakes, and fostering lifelong friendships. The YC experience was a pivotal moment for Resend, with the team expressing a desire to contribute back to the community. The mention of "a16zResend" suggests a collaboration or backing from Andreessen Horowitz.

---

**High-Quality Q&A Pairs:**

1.  **Q: What is the core purpose of Resend, and for whom is it primarily designed?**
    *   **A:** Resend is an email sending platform built from the ground up to provide startups with the fastest and most integrated way to send mission-critical emails. Its primary design focus is on serving startups of all sizes.

2.  **Q: Who is the founder of Resend, and when did their Y Combinator journey begin and culminate in acceptance?**
    *   **A:** Resend was founded by Zeno Rocha. Their Y Combinator journey began with an application submission on September 12, 2022, and culminated in acceptance into the Winter 2023 batch on November 30, 2022.

3.  **Q: What immediate actions did the Resend team take after being accepted into Y Combinator?**
    *   **A:** Immediately upon acceptance into Y Combinator, the Resend team quit their jobs and moved to San Francisco to begin working towards gaining traction within three months before Demo Day as part of the Winter 2023 batch.

4.  **Q: What key benefits does Resend highlight for its users, and how can new users get started?**
    *   **A:** Resend highlights its fully integrated platform for fast email sending, designed for mission-critical emails for growing teams. New users can get started by signing up for free and can claim specific deals.

5.  **Q: What is implied by the "a16zResend" reference in the context of the platform?**
    *   **A:** The "a16zResend" reference strongly implies a partnership, investment, or significant backing from Andreessen Horowitz (a16z), a prominent venture capital firm, indicating substantial support for the Resend platform.

qa:
Resend aims to revolutionize email, which they believe is "stuck in the past" despite advancements in web technology. The company started in 2022 as an open-source project, initially frustrated by the difficulty of creating modern email templates that worked consistently across various clients. Digging deeper, they identified the primary pain point as ensuring emails successfully reach the inbox rather than the spam folder.

In 2023, Resend launched a comprehensive email sending platform and joined Y Combinator's winter batch. Their mission is to build the best communication platform for developers. The company operates as a fully remote team, guided by strong principles:
1.  **Do work that inspires others:** Emphasizing phenomenal quality and continuously raising the bar.
2.  **No ego:** Fostering a collaborative environment where asking for help is encouraged, and communication is kind, direct, and transparent.
3.  **Keep shipping:** Prioritizing speed, ruthless prioritization, and a focus on shipping early and often, aiming for a "v0" instead of delaying for "v1."
4.  **Default to action:** Empowering team members as "makers" to take initiative, solve problems creatively, and submit solutions without waiting for instructions.

Resend is backed by a prestigious group of investors, including founders and leaders from prominent tech companies like Pixar, Figma, Vercel, Segment, Sentry, Mailchimp, Plaid, and Stripe, among others.

Key company milestones include introducing Resend in January 2023, joining Y Combinator in February 2023, and most recently, raising an $18M Series A round in December 2024. The company is actively hiring individuals who are passionate about quality to help build their vision.

---

**High-Quality Q&A Pairs:**

1.  **Q: What core problems does Resend aim to solve in the email landscape?**
    **A:** Resend aims to solve the problems of email being "stuck in the past," specifically addressing the difficulty of building modern email templates that work across all clients and, most importantly, ensuring emails reach the inbox instead of the spam folder.

2.  **Q: When was Resend founded as a platform, and what significant milestone occurred shortly after its launch?**
    **A:** Resend launched its full email sending platform in 2023. Shortly after, it joined Y Combinator's winter batch, a significant accelerator program for startups.

3.  **Q: What are the four core principles that guide Resend's team and decision-making?**
    **A:** Resend's four core principles are: "Do work that inspires others" (quality), "No ego" (collaboration and transparency), "Keep shipping" (speed and iteration), and "Default to action" (initiative and problem-solving).

4.  **Q: How does Resend approach product development and iteration according to its principles?**
    **A:** Resend prioritizes speed, ruthless prioritization, and a strong sense of urgency. They aim to "ship early, and ship often," focusing on a "v0" rather than delaying for a "v1," and constantly review project scope.

5.  **Q: Has Resend secured external funding, and if so, what was a notable recent investment?**
    **A:** Yes, Resend has secured external funding from numerous notable investors. A recent notable investment was raising an $18M Series A round in December 2024.

qa:
Resend is an email sending service highlighted for its seamless integration with Astro sites, enabling developers to send reliable, production-ready emails. It's praised by Astro core team members for its universal compatibility across various Astro deployment environments, including Node servers, serverless functions, and Cloudflare workers.

Integration with Astro is facilitated through Resend's Node SDK or API endpoints. By adding an SSR adapter, developers can send emails, create contacts, and perform other server-side operations safely. Resend also offers robust integration with Astro Actions, providing a type-safe backend for handling form submissions, which can progressively enhance the user experience.

For React developers, Resend enhances the workflow through its `react.email` collection. This provides high-quality, unstyled components for crafting beautiful emails using TypeScript, addressing inconsistencies often found across different email clients.

Numerous testimonials underscore Resend's benefits:
*   **Ease of Use & Reliability:** Many users commend its simplicity, making email sending easy and dependable.
*   **Improved Deliverability:** Features like Dedicated IPs are cited for significantly boosting email deliverability and reducing spam complaints.
*   **Superior Developer Experience:** Developers often compare it favorably to competitors like Mailgun, Sendgrid, and Mandrill, highlighting a smoother, modern, and user-centric approach.
*   **Performance & Support:** Fast integration, intricate knowledge of email, and relentless support are noted advantages.
*   **Advanced Features:** Multi-region sending is a "game-changer" for customers with specific geographical needs, and webhook support allows for tracking events like email opens and clicks.
*   **Visual & Workflow Integration:** The product is described as visually stunning and integrates seamlessly with React Email, allowing developers to build emails without leaving their development environment.

Resend aims to provide a modern, efficient, and reliable solution for managing mission-critical emails, offering quick setup and comprehensive resources to get started.

---

**High-Quality Q&A Pairs:**

1.  **Q: What is Resend and its primary advantage for Astro developers?**
    **A:** Resend is an email sending service that offers seamless and reliable integration for Astro sites. Its primary advantage is its universal compatibility across various Astro deployment environments (Node, serverless, Cloudflare workers) and its focus on a smooth developer experience.

2.  **Q: How can Resend be integrated into an Astro site for server-side email sending?**
    **A:** Resend integrates into Astro sites via its Node SDK or API endpoints. By adding an SSR (Server-Side Rendering) adapter, developers can safely send emails, create contacts, and perform other email-related operations directly from the server in any supported Astro deployment environment.

3.  **Q: What specific benefits does Resend offer to React developers working within an Astro ecosystem?**
    **A:** For React developers, Resend integrates with `react.email`, providing a collection of high-quality, unstyled components for building beautiful and consistent emails using TypeScript. This helps overcome design inconsistencies across different email clients and allows for email development within the familiar React environment.

4.  **Q: According to user testimonials, what are some key non-technical advantages of using Resend?**
    **A:** Users frequently praise Resend for its ease of setup, reliability, and significantly improved email deliverability, especially with features like Dedicated IPs. It also stands out for its superior developer experience compared to older services, responsive customer support, and specific features like multi-region sending for geographical proximity to users.

5.  **Q: Does Resend support advanced functionalities like tracking email events or handling form submissions with type safety?**
    **A:** Yes, Resend supports advanced functionalities. It integrates with Astro Actions for type-safe backend functions to handle form email submissions efficiently. Additionally, it allows users to track email events like opens and clicks via webhooks, which can be integrated with other analytics platforms.
